intro: Wedelia copiapina, commonly known as the Copiapó wedelia, is a flowering plant native to Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to the arid environments where it thrives. It is often found in rocky soils and coastal areas, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
